replies.text:
@usernamesreprise9417 Well yes. A couple of points. The rank in The British Army is Brigadier. Brigadier General is an American military rank. We are not American. Yet.
In 1939 he had already made The University of Sydney aware that he would leave if war broke out. When this happened he returned to England & found the Civil Servants could not cope with the conscription process. However a loophole existed for men from The Colonies who jumped the queue. Powell was categorised as Australian & joined The Royal Warwickshire Regiment (his County of birth). In Whos Who Powell stated that his greatest achievement was promotion from Private to Lance Corporal!
During a visit from a Staff Officer in 1940 Powell's recognitionoccured when a joke was made about Greece to which Powell responded in perfect Greek. He was swiftly transferred toThe Intelligence Corps & commissioned. The rest is History......
PS The other man who rose from Private to Brigadier in WW2 was Fitzroy Maclean.

replies.text:
@njd2342

Oliver Cromwell‚Äôs speech dismissing Rump Parliament on 
20 April 1653, London, England.


‚ÄúIt is high time for me to put an end to your sitting in this place,
which you have dishonored by your contempt of all virtue, and defiled by your practice of every vice.
Ye are a factious crew, and enemies to all good government.

Ye are a pack of mercenary wretches, and would like Esau sell your country for a mess of pottage, and like Judas betray your God for a few pieces of money.

Is there a single virtue now remaining amongst you? Is there one vice you do not possess?

Ye have no more religion than my horse. Gold is your God. Which of you have not bartered your conscience for bribes? Is there a man amongst you that has the least care for the good of the Commonwealth?

Ye sordid prostitutes have you not defiled this sacred place, and turned the Lord's temple into a den of thieves, by your immoral principles and wicked practices?

Ye are grown intolerably odious to the whole nation. 
You were deputed here by the people to get grievances redressed, are yourselves become the greatest grievance.‚Ä®‚Ä®Your country therefore calls upon me to cleanse this Augean stable, by putting a final period to your iniquitous proceedings in this House; and which by God's help, and the strength he has given me, I am now come to do.

I command ye therefore, upon the peril of your lives, to depart immediately out of this place.

Go, get you out! Make haste! 
Ye venal slaves be gone! So! 
Take away that shining bauble there, and lock up the doors.‚Ä®‚Ä®In the name of God, go!‚Äù

replies.author: @edithcrowther9604
replies.text:
The total population in England and Wales as at midnight on Sunday, 8th April, 1951, according to preliminary summaries furnished by local Census Officers was 43,744,924 persons, 21,024,187 being males and 22,720,737 females.  It should have stayed the same after that until now, or even gone down a bit if everyone was to have a slightly better standard of living.  There was a native Baby Boom after the War - but not for long.  The huge increase in population since then has been almost entirely due to immigration and births to immigrants, initially from our former Empire (now called the "Commonwealth") but after than from anywhere.  There was a native post-War "Baby Boom".  A total of 46,071,604 persons were enumerated in England and Wales as at midnight on Sunday, 23rd April, 1961.  Were all of the extra 2.25 million babies white British or white Irish? - obviously not.  
Official Census results are not published until 100 years after the event, since they were made an Official Secret in 1920.  But you can get unofficial sets of figures, though the Preliminary Summaries are only available for 1951 and 1961.  By 1981 the population of England and Wales seems to have risen to 48.5 million, and it is not known how much of this extra 4.5 million since 1951 was due to a native Baby Boom and how much to Immigration and births to Immigrants.  But if we say half was native Births over Deaths, that is a mere 2.25 million - who have not then gone on to have large families themselves, for the most part.  The rise after 1981 was steady, and I would argue not attributable to anything but Immigration and births to Immigrants, since the native Baby Boom ended in 1964.  There was a 4% rise between 1991 and 2001, an 8% rise between 2001 and 2011, and a 6% rise between 2011 and 2021.  [Not counting several million illegals over that period.]  
The rises are cumulative - i.e. each rise is on top of an already enlarged figure for the previous Census.  Perhaps you can see why I am a bit gloomy - and another reason I am gloomy is just how difficult it was to find these unofficial figures.  Why was the Census an Official Secret from 1920 onwards?  All Censuses taken between 1931 and 2021 will be published 100 years later (except 1931 which would have been published in 2031 but sadly was destroyed in a fire in 1942).

author: @Whyculturematters
text: The reference is not from "a Virgil book", is from the Aeneid, book VI. It's a cornestone of Western literature. And it doesn't talk about the fall of Rome, it's about the state of warfare in Italy after Aeneas' arrival (Aeneas was himself an immigrant). Also, Virgil couldn't possibly write about the fall of Rome as it would only happen more than four centuries later.
